ReviewList.Text: I used this textbook as part of a College Algebra Based 2-Semester (4hr/4hr) sequence.  I had never taken Physics in high school due to taking a different science for my final one in high school, so I went in there with not much to work with.  Having said that though, this book is amazing, it has clear cut examples, formulas and descriptions and 100+ problems in every chapter to get plenty of practice.  The online homework supplement however is horrid, but the book itself is great.

Arrived very quickly. It was a good textbook, very informative and straight forward. Does not use very complex math to explain the concepts presented. Provided a good reintroduction to Physics for me after not having taken it since high school physics.
Good reference text in addition to being a classroom Physics book.  Something you'll keep even after you return all your other books for the money at the end of the semester.

I am currently taking Physics I and this is the textbook that is required. I absolutely hate this textbook. The explanations are never clear and uses so much jargon. I hope that I can pass Physics this semester with this awful excuse of a textbook.

The content of this book is pretty crappy, blah, who likes physics, but if it's what you need for class then so be it. It's very hard to read, but a great book once you get your copy. Not too helpful with anything, but, its a book
